Description: NATIONAL WETLANDS INVENTORY (NWI) IS A KEY DATASET FOR WETLAND ECOSYSTEMS CONSERVATION ACROSSTHE U.S. HOWEVER, THIS DATASET IS NOT CONTEMPORARY FOR MUCH OF THE U.S. AND NEEDS TO BE UPDATEDTO REFLECT THE CHANGES OF WETLANDS. THIS PROJECT MAKES USE OF CONTEMPORARY LAND COVER PRODUCTS(NLCD AND CCAP), TIME SERIES SATELLITE DATA (LANDSAT AND SENTINEL), AND ADVANCED COMPUTATIONMETHODS (GOOGLE EARTH ENGINE AND HIGH PERFORMANCE COMPUTER) TO SUPPORT A MORE EFFICIENT ANDCOST-EFFECTIVE NWI PRODUCTION WORKFLOW. MORE SPECIFICALLY, THIS PROJECT AIMS TO IDENTIFY THEHOTSPOTS OF WETLAND CHANGES AT CENSUS TRACT AND WATERSHED LEVELS, TARGETING THE REGIONS WITH MOSTWETLAND LOSS AND OPEN WATER GAIN. THE CENSUS TRACTS AND WATERSHEDS IDENTIFIED ARE POTENTIALLY THEREGIONS THAT NEED TO BE UPDATED THE MOST. THE STATISTICS OF WETLAND LOSS TO IMPERVIOUS SURFACE OFEACH NWI POLYGON WILL ALSO BE CALCULATED, IN AN EFFORT TO IDENTIFY THE WETLAND POLYGONS WITH MOSTWETLAND LOSS. THE NEW OPEN WATER GAIN WILL ALSO BE IDENTIFIED AND CONVERTED INTO POLYGONS, WHICHWILL AID IN THE CREATION OF STANDARD COMPLIANT NEW NWI DATA. THE PRODUCTS, METADATA, AND PROJECTREPORT DERIVED THROUGH THIS STUDY WILL BE DELIVERED TO FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (FWS).

THIS PROJECT WILL GENERATE UPDATED NATIONAL WETLANDS INVENTORY (NWI) SPATIAL DATA FOR THE TAMPA BAY REGION OF FLORIDA. THE CURRENT NWI SPATIAL INVENTORY FOR THE TAMPA BAY REGION WAS COMPLETED IN 2010 AND DOES NOT ACCURATELY REPRESENT CURRENTLY EXISTING WETLAND HABITAT, MAKING IT OBSOLETE IN TERMS OF VALUE FOR RESOURCE MANAGERS PERFORMING PLANNING AND ANALYSIS.COINCIDENT WITH NWI DATA PRODUCTION DESCRIBED ABOVE, DUCKS UNLIMITED, INC. (DU) WILL ASSESS THE FEASIBILITY AND BENEFITS OF INCORPORATING NOAA C-CAP DATA INTO THE NWI DATA PRODUCTION WORKFLOW. NWI DATA HAVE HISTORICALLY BEEN USED TO SUPPORT THE PRODUCTION OF C-CAP WETLANDS DATA. THIS PROJECT WILL HELP DETERMINE WHETHER C-CAP DATA CAN BE USED TO IMPROVE THE EFFICIENCY OR COST-EFFECTIVENESS OF THE NWI DATA PRODUCTION PROCESS.THE METHODS AND ANALYSES DEVELOPED TO USE C-CAP TO SUPPORT NWI DATA CREATION IN PUGET SOUND WILL BE APPLIED TO THE TAMPA BAY AREA. THEY WILL BE USED TO DETERMINE IF THE MOST RECENT C-CAP DATA WILL IMPROVE NWI DATA PRODUCTION WHILST PERFORMING A COMPLETE UPDATE OF THE AREA.

THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST USFWS IN MEETING THEIR REQUIREMENT TO PRODUCE NATIONALLY STANDARD COMPLIANT NWI DATA FOR ALASKA. STANDARDS THAT GSS FOLLOWS INCLUDE THOSE DESCRIBED IN CLASSIFICATION OF WETLANDS AND DEEPWATER HABITATS OF THE U.S. (COWARDIN ET AL., 1979, REVISED 2013)  AND FEDERAL WETLANDS MAPPING STANDARD (2009). FOR THE FIRST PHASE, GSS WILL IDENTIFY AND MAP WETLANDS USING THE MOST CURRENT DIGITAL IMAGERY AND ANCILLARY DATASETS PROVIDED OR IDENTIFIED BY THE USFWS (E.G., MAXAR MOSAIC, NOAA LAND COVER, IFSAR OR LIDAR). THE MAPPING WILL BE COMPLETED AT A RESOLUTION OF A ONE-ACRE TARGET MAP UNIT IN THE COASTAL AREA OF THE TOGIAK PENINSULA AND THE PRIBILOFF ISLANDS (FIGURE 1). ALL MAPPING WILL UNDERGO 100  INTERNAL QUALITY CONTROL AND WILL BE VALIDATED USING CUSTOMIZED NWI VERIFICATION TOOLS DEVELOPED BY USFWS. FOUR DATA ITERATIONS OF USFWS QUALITY CONTROL WILL BE COMPLETED FOR EACH MAPPING AREA. QC ITERATION SUBMISSIONS WILL OCCUR NO LESS THAN EIGHT WEEKS APART.DATA DEVELOPMENT WILL BE CONDUCTED OVER A 2- TO 5-YEAR TIMEFRAME. THIS FUNDING OPPORTUNITY WILL SUPPORT ACTIVITIES REQUIRED TO PRODUCE CUSTOMIZED, SPATIALLY-EXPLICIT DATASETS THAT IDENTIFY WETLAND FEATURES AND ESTABLISH THEIR CONNECTIVITY WITHIN A WATERSHED CONTEXT. GEOSPATIAL DATASETS WILL BE DEVELOPED AND ASSEMBLED ACCORDING TO NATIONAL WETLAND MAPPING AND CLASSIFICATION STANDARDS, AND REVIEWED ACCORDING TO NATIONAL MAPPING QUALITY ASSURANCE QUALITY CONTROL PROTOCOLS. SPATIALLY-EXPLICIT DATASETS WILL FOCUS ON CHARACTERIZING RIVER AND STREAM CHANNELS, OPEN WATERBODIES, AND WETLAND FEATURES CONSISTENT IN DETAIL TO THAT ESTABLISHED FOR FEATURE DELINEATION.

DUCKS UNLIMITED'S (DU) PURPOSE IN THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (FWS) IN CONDUCTING MAPPING AND DATA IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE NATIONAL WETLANDS INVENTORY (NWI) IN A COLLECTION OF WATERSHEDS IN NORTHERN AND WESTERN UPSTATE NEW YORK ENCOMPASSING NEARLY TWO MILLION ACRES. NEW DATA WILL BE COLLECTED FROM THE MOST CURRENT ORTHO IMAGERY AND ANCILLARY DATASETS OF THE PROJECT AREAS, AND WETLANDS WITHIN THE PROJECT BOUNDARY WILL BE DELINEATED, CLASSIFIED, AND DIGITIZED BY DU PERSONNEL. DURING AND AFTER THIS PROCESS, QUALITY ASSURANCE AND CONTROL WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH REMOTE SENSING TECHNIQUES, VERIFICATION IN THE FIELD, AND OVERSIGHT OF EXPERIENCED ANALYSTS. ONCE DATA HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AND MAPPED FOR THE ENTIRE PROJECT AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH THESE STANDARDS, IT WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE FWS AND NWI NATIONAL QUALITY ASSURANCE COORDINATOR.THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT, DU WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE FWS TO ENSURE THE DATA IS CREATED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE OFFICIAL FWS WETLAND CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM, THE FEDERAL GEOGRAPHIC DATA COMMITTEE STANDARD FOR WETLAND CLASSIFICATION (ADOPTED ON JULY 29, 1996: 61 FEDERAL REGISTER 39465), AND THE FWS'S DATA COLLECTION REQUIREMENTS AND PROCEDURES FOR MAPPING WETLAND, DEEPWATER, AND RELATED HABITATS OF THE UNITED STATES (AUGUST 2015). THE PROJECT'S FINAL PRODUCT WILL BE STANDARD-COMPLIANT DIGITAL NWI VERSION 2 DATA FOR THE PROJECT AREA. BEFORE IT IS INTEGRATED INTO THE NWI IT WILL PASS THE WETLANDS DATA VERIFICATION TOOLSET DEVELOPED BY THE FWS AND WILL COMPLY WITH ALL FWS DATA QUALITY GUIDELINES. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE PUBLICATION QUALITY PROJECT METADATA FOR POSTING ON THE WETLANDS MAPPER WEB APPLICATION. ONCE REVIEW AND QUALITY ASSURANCE ARE COMPLETE, THE DATA WILL BE DELIVERED TO THE FWS IN THE STANDARD FILE GEODATABASE FORMAT AND DATA SCHEMA. IN BEING ADDED TO THE NWI, IT WILL BE INTEGRATED INTO THE NATIONAL SPATIAL DATA INFRASTRUCTURE, DEFINED BY THE GEOSPATIAL DATA ACT OF 2018 AS "THE TECHNOLOGY, POLICIES, CRITERIA, STANDARDS, AND EMPLOYEES NECESSARY TO PROMOTE GEOSPATIAL DATA SHARING THROUGHOUT THE FEDERAL, STATE, TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR (INCLUDING NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION)". THE DATA WILL PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE INFORMATION TO AID BIOLOGISTS AND OTHER PROFESSIONALS IN CONSERVATION EFFORTS.

DUCKS UNLIMITED INC.'S (DU) PURPOSE IN THIS PROJECT IS TO ASSIST THE U.S. FISH AND WILDLIFE SERVICE (FWS) IN  CONDUCTING MAPPING AND DATA IMPROVEMENTS FOR THE NATIONAL WETLANDS INVENTORY (NWI) IN A COLLECTION OF WATERSHEDS  IN NORTHERN AND WESTERN UPSTATE OHIO ENCOMPASSING NEARLY THREE MILLION ACRES INCLUDING DEEP WATER HABITAT. NEW  DATA WILL BE COLLECTED FROM THE MOST CURRENT ORTHO IMAGERY AND ANCILLARY DATASETS OF THE PROJECT AREAS, AND  WETLANDS WITHIN THE PROJECT BOUNDARY WILL BE DELINEATED, CLASSIFIED, AND DIGITIZED BY DU PERSONNEL. DURING AND  AFTER THIS PROCESS, QUALITY ASSURANCE AND CONTROL WILL BE CONDUCTED THROUGH REMOTE SENSING TECHNIQUES,  VERIFICATION IN THE FIELD, AND OVERSIGHT OF EXPERIENCED ANALYSTS. ONCE DATA HAS BEEN CLASSIFIED AND MAPPED FOR  THE ENTIRE PROJECT AREA IN ACCORDANCE WITH THESE STANDARDS, IT WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE FWS AND NWI NATIONAL  QUALITY ASSURANCE COORDINATOR.  THROUGHOUT THE PROJECT, DU WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE FWS TO ENSURE THE DATA IS CREATED IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE  OFFICIAL FWS WETLAND CLASSIFICATION SYSTEM, THE FEDERAL GEOGRAPHIC DATA COMMITTEE STANDARD FOR WETLAND  CLASSIFICATION (ADOPTED ON JULY 29, 1996: 61 FEDERAL REGISTER 39465), AND THE FWS'S DATA COLLECTION REQUIREMENTS  AND PROCEDURES FOR MAPPING WETLAND, DEEPWATER, AND RELATED HABITATS OF THE UNITED STATES (AUGUST 2015). THE  PROJECT'S FINAL PRODUCT WILL BE STANDARD-COMPLIANT DIGITAL NWI VERSION 2 DATA FOR THE PROJECT AREA. BEFORE IT IS  INTEGRATED INTO THE NWI IT WILL PASS THE WETLANDS DATA VERIFICATION TOOLSET DEVELOPED BY THE FWS AND WILL COMPLY  WITH ALL FWS DATA QUALITY GUIDELINES. IT WILL ALSO INCLUDE PUBLICATION QUALITY PROJECT METADATA FOR POSTING ON  THE WETLANDS MAPPER WEB APPLICATION. ONCE REVIEW AND QUALITY ASSURANCE ARE COMPLETE, THE DATA WILL BE DELIVERED  TO THE FWS IN THE STANDARD FILE GEODATABASE FORMAT AND DATA SCHEMA. IN BEING ADDED TO THE NWI, IT WILL BE  INTEGRATED INTO THE NATIONAL SPATIAL DATA INFRASTRUCTURE, DEFINED BY THE GEOSPATIAL DATA ACT OF 2018 AS "THE  TECHNOLOGY, POLICIES, CRITERIA, STANDARDS, AND EMPLOYEES NECESSARY TO PROMOTE GEOSPATIAL DATA SHARING THROUGHOUT  THE FEDERAL, STATE, TRIBAL, AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, AND THE PRIVATE SECTOR (INCLUDING NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS AND  INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION)". THE DATA WILL PROVIDE ACCESSIBLE INFORMATION TO AID BIOLOGISTS AND OTHER  PROFESSIONALS IN CONSERVATION EFFORTS.
